bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Edith and her husband Isadore Chavat were apparently rank and file activists in the Young Communist League and the Communist Party in Brooklyn, New York, and at Brooklyn College.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Edith Chevat Papers; TAM 247; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This unprocessed collection contains printed ephemera (including ephemeral serials), and internal documents of Communist Party USA and Communist Party led organizations, including the Young Communist League (YCL), the American Student Union and American Youth for Democracy. The collection documents Communist activity at Brooklyn College, particularly anti-war activity of the period of the Hitler-Stalin Pact (1939-1941), and campus free speech issues. There is also some YCL material from Brooklynâ€™s New Utrecht neighborhood and high school.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Edith Chevat, the creator of this collection, were transferred to New York University in 2001. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Edith Chevat sent a gift of communist related materials documenting progressive 1930s activism in Brooklyn and at Brooklyn College. The accession number associated with this collection is 2001.203.
